intro: Embolanthera spicata, commonly known as the spike embolanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Embolanthera spicata is often found in regions with a temperate climate and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
